name: Aid childbirth
text: Labour becomes very easy and free of complications. No particular drawback. Very popular civilian magic.

name: Augment
text: You get +1 combat. Can be cast even while holding a weapon.

name: Cryokinesis
text: Slowly cool target object. Can get from room temperature to -40 degrees over 10 minutes.

name: Disintegrate
text: You can tear crystalline matter to dust. +3* combat and 5* @AP:armour piercing@, and on a hit, dust a weapon or suit of armour instead of inflicting damage. TODO Too strong? It means a red mage counters an armour warrior pretty hard; and I don't want magic to simply trump everything.

name: Fertilise
text: Target plant grows 10% faster for 24 hours. Not channelled.

name: Geokinesis
text: Shape crystalline (ie metal, rock, ceramic) matter. (This lacks precision: if you try it on organic, it ruptures cell walls and you get slush.) Effective in crafting, repairs, and peeling through walls. Subject matter takes on consistency of wet clay, so you can't reshape diamond into carbon nanotubes.

name: Hydrokinesis
text: You gain some telekinetic power over water nearby. +3* combat, +3 @ranged@. Take an additional +5 to all physical while in water.

name: Kollakinesis
text: You gain some telekinetic power over glue nearby, including the ability to conjure small amounts. +3* combat, +2 @ranged@, @net@. Can conjure glue, soften it, etc. TODO If casters counter movers, what counters casters?

name: Mouseform
text: -10 size.

name: Ogreform
text: +2 size, +2 combat, but can't use a weapon.

name: Panikinesis
text: Kinesis over cloth. Has enough coordination to make fibres bind to each other and efficiently weave multiple strands together in parallel. Can be used with a rope/ribbon/etc for +4* @net@. Good for repairs.

name: Photokinesis
text: You gain some control over light, including the ability to conjure glowing glass-like forcefields. +7* @armour@, +5* @ranged@. Can conjure illumination of any colour; can also suppress light.

name: Pyrokinesis
text: You gain some fire control power, including the ability to conjure it, but not put it out. +5* combat, +4 @ranged@. Create a POW=3* fire with every clash, on your position if you lose, target if you win. Can conjure light, set stuff on fire.

name: Sterilise
text: Kill bacteria, insect eggs, mould spores, viruses, or other tiny pests. Can be used prophylactically to prevent milk from souring, etc. Use for +1 to checks to treat @bleeding@.

name: Telekinesis
text: You gain some general but relatively weak telekinesis. +3 combat, +4 @ranged@. Can pick up, push, or pull items from long range. Carry capacity capped at half your weight, so you can't fly, but can propel self for +5 to jumps.

name: Terminate pregnancy
text: A magical abortion. A spell is less hassle than a potion, but it's illegal and the mage has less plausible deniability, so the potion is often preferred.

name: Transmute
text: Temporarily change the composition of crystalline matter. Maximum size is $level-5 fewer size categories; this lasts indefinitely, but if you try to transmute more, the first part reverts. Mass is conserved, not volume. At level 0, you can make base salts and materials (lead, table salt, copper); at level 1, can make iron, zinc, most ceramics, and can revert to original material; at level 2, can make diamond (it's not valuable in-universe); at level 3, can make titanium. Can't make noble metals, radioactive materials, or manite ever.

name: Water breathing, walking
text: You and up to 0* allies don't drown, sink. At level 2+, water breathing is actually oxygen creation or unbreathing, so that smoke inhalation and hard vacuum also don't kill you.

name: Antimagic shell
text: Anyone engaging you has -5* magic. Any who tries to cast at you takes 2 -1 magic tokens. TODO it's a pretty brutal hard counter to combat casters; too strong?

name: Boost
text: Assist an ally's spellcasting, ie their casting attribute counts as min(attr, you.MAS)+5.

name: Copyrite
text: Copy a spell of requirement up to this.requirement that was cast last round, of any colour. This includes combat spells. You must pay any additional costs of that spell such as manite.

name: Disenchant
text: Break an enchantment of requirement equal or lower to this plus 5. Does not affect spells that are permanent without enchantment, such as curses.

name: Disjunction
text: Even the lightest touch cancels magic. +10* vs summons.

name: Enchant
text: The duration of some other spell of requirement<=this.requirement-5 becomes permanent. The spell isn't being cast, so it doesn't give combat bonuses; you can do things like eternal fire, bound summons, etc, but not a flamethrower. This can't make enchanted wearable gear. This requires manite; say, 5*(target.requirement) grams. If Enchant is used with Inscribe, the item has enchant.level charges, and can be recharged by use of this spell, without requiring manite.

name: Inscribe
text: Some other spell of requirement<=this.requirement-5 is inscribed onto a solid object, whence it can be 'cast' in response to a trigger, which is typically either reading a scroll or touching a glyph, customarily marked with a crossed circle. Lasts until used or until the glyph is erased. Requires target.requirement grams of manite.

name: Loan
text: Ueoc, one nearby ally gains access to one of your spells and you lose access to it. They use their own stats to cast it.

name: Meditate
text: Enter a magical combat trance and open your mind to higher states. +3* combat, take +1 magic aeor, capped at +$magic.

name: Mnemonophage
text: Target character forgets a spell.

name: Antigrav
text: Negate the force of gravity on yourself and up to 0* allies or objects of equal or lesser size. Can use this for pseudo flight, but landing is the tricky part. You don't negate the weight of any of your gear, if that matters, only living biological material.

name: Bubble
text: Cordon yourself and some nearby area into an ad hoc pocket dimension, such that nobody can enter or leave. There must be a keystone on the outside (ie the non-you side); if it is destroyed, or you are incapacitated, the spell fizzles.

name: Create pocket dimension
text: Create a small, short-lived extra dimension. Combined with enchanting to create a dimensional warehouse: you bind multiple dimensions to a manite layer, breach them, and you have a DW. Most also have control systems, using purple: if you don't, a thief can steal your cargo.

name: Create wormhole
text: Create a pocket dimension with two access points that can be moved freely.

name: Dimensional breach
text: Tunnel into an alternate dimension with similar world coordinates.

name: Flashstep
text: Instantly move up to 50m if you could walk there (you can walk past a guard, you can't walk over a wall). +3* combat, treat combat as pure melee. +5* to chase checks.

name: Gravity tilt
text: +5* to climb; everyone within melee engagement range of you has their base $fight capped at their $athletics.

name: Hammerspace
text: Access a pocket dimension that can fit up to -5* size categories of stuff. Its access point is locked to your position.

name: Space warp
text: Change spatial geometry nearby. You can make something bigger on the inside than out, make areas closer or further.

name: Stasis
text: Time does not pass within a space equal to you.size*. Must be channelled (or more usefully, enchanted).

name: Suspend
text: +3* to combat, and on a hit, the target is sent 1 round into the future (in addition to any damage).

name: Time warp
text: Create a pocket dimension with two apertures with different coordinates in time.

name: Biomancy
text: Diagnose infections, injuries, pregnancies, vitamin deficiencies, etc

name: Chameleon
text: @Veil:veil@ yourself. At level 1, you may instead veil an ally (the veil breaks when they cast a spell); at level 2, you may veil both yourself and one ally.

name: Clarity
text: +10* to spot @veil@s

name: Disguise
text: Create a $veil$ on yourself that makes you look like someone else, if you successfully check MAS+stealth vs MET+vig. To look like someone in particular, take -5. Getting touched breaks the veil, so suspicious people often ask to tap each other.

name: Encrypt
text: Hard-scramble information indefinitely, unless a passphrase or other slipknot is applied. This isn't a veil, it's obvious that information is there, it just can't be parsed, eg writing will be visible but rendered as lorem ipsum. Combined with DWs such that if you don't have the key, you absolutely can't get at the cargo, and if you just try to smash the door, it'll collapse the dimension and you'll never get the cargo. Encryption can be disenchanted; but it's often combined with other enchantments, such that if you break the encryption, you'll destroy the entire item anyway.

name: Facade
text: Create a static visual @veil@ of up to 2m squared. Its texture behaves like an object in your blind spot, eg if you put a facade over a small hole in a wall, it will look like the rest of the wall.

name: Geomancy
text: Identify composition of crystals

name: Haze
text: Create a @veil@ of up to 5m cubed. It is obvious that there is a veil there, but not what is behind it. Anyone shooting into or out of it treats it as cover.

name: Kaleidomancy
text: The area is bathed in sensory chaos: glittering lights, musical bells, strange smells. For all actions, everyone's base skill is capped at their vigilance.

name: Meteomancy
text: Predict the weather, 1* day into the future within 1*km.

name: Necromancy
text: Speak with the dead. Each unique caster may speak with each corpse for up to 1* minute. The corpse may or may not be cooperative, but they tend to be amenable to getting revenge on their killers.

name: Olfamancy
text: Gain enhanced smell. You can identify species, identity, and any injuries of anyone nearby who's left a scent trail within the past few days. You don't know the name or face of anyone you smell, but if you know them from elsewhere, you can match the two.

name: Precognition
text: +4*, +10* vigilance vs sneak attacks. Can only be cast if you haven't cast non-blue magic since your last rest. This can be maintained while asleep, where it lets you wake to react to sneak attacks, with no bonus.

name: Scotopic
text: You and up to 0* allies can see in the dark.

name: Tag, track
text: Tag up to 1* items with a hash of your choosing; you can detect the direction (but not distance) to a tagged item if you know its hash, if it's within 1* times 100m.

name: Telesophy
text: Send messages to anyone on the T-soph network.

name: Veilbreaker
text: Check MET+vigilance+5* vs a veil's MAS+stealth+$level; on a pass, break any veil nearby (even if you weren't aware of it); on a fail, you can't cast this again today.

name: Watcher
text: Create a Watcher that attaches to an incapacitated target. Once per day, you may share their senses for up to 1* minute. You can do this remotely, although obviously they might just be on the toilet or daydreaming or something. They are not typically aware of this. You aren't aware of their thoughts, memories, or other non-sensory data. The Watcher is weak to orange magic and can be killed by any sort of dispel effect, regardless of whether you're targeting it. Per level, you gain an additional sense: audio, video, smell, taste, touch, proprioception, pain, balance, hunger, thermo ... although as long as you have audiovideo you can probably figure out the others. A person may host no more than one Watcher at a time.

name: X-ray vision
text: See through solid objects, up to 1* times 10cm. Specifically, your vision skips ahead up to 10cm from the first opaque object, so if there are two sheets of paper spaced 5cm apart you can see through both, but you can't if they're 15cm apart. In the former case, you're aware of the first piece, like how you can see the palm of a hand you put over one eye.

name: Bind wisp
text: +6* and +4 ranged vs wisps, and on a hit, you @dominate@ it. They're very powerful servants, but there's a catch: they feed on the spell's energy, gradually becoming stronger without upper limit. Eventually, they break free, and then there's an extra-strong wisp. Responsible use is to let it loose in the wild, where the extra strength dissipates harmlessly. Purple mages are always responsible, right?

name: Compromise
text: Inflict Compromised on an incapacitated target. Once per day, you may take control of them for 1* round. You steal their senses during. You can't act yourself at the same time, and you don't generally know ahead of time whether they're in a position to do anything you care about. They have no memory of this, and aren't necessarily aware that they're compromised. Lasts indefinitely, until disenchanted.

name: Create curse
text: A magical parasite that infests a victim and inflicts some nuisancesome condition until removed. Curses can be delivered by trap or to any Incapacitated character.

name: Eroarchy
text: Make someone fall in or out of love. Technically only lasts while channelled, but people tend to rationalise their love, so it has long-term secondary effect.

name: Hypnoarchy
text: Make someone fall asleep. On a hit, instead of inflicting N damage, inflict N* @fatigue@; and if the target then has 10 or more fatigue, they are @incapacitated@. One solid hit puts a target to sleep, and they can't be awoken by any means for at least 10 minutes.

name: Necroarchy
text: Animate up to 1* nearby corpses.

name: Klemarchy
text: @Dominate@ target animate vine.

name: Subvert
text: +2*. On a hit, the target takes Subverted ueoc. If they would be incapacitated, instead their focus is fully restored and they are @dominated:dominate@ ueoc with no debuffs. They faint aeob. If the target is already subverted, this is a crit.

name: Summon lesser minion
text: @Summon:summon@ a copy of yourself except that all attributes are 2 lower; and take 3 -1 magic tokens. It has copies of whatever items you carry, but if it puts them down, they disappear; and consumables don't work, even if it uses them on itself. The minion may be reflavoured.

name: Summon phantasms
text: As for summon lesser minion, except you get 3, its attributes equal yours, and it can't inflict damage or debuffs or physically affect anything. It can engage enemies; they may choose to ignore it, in which case they aren't interrupted from whatever they were doing, but if they ignore a real attacker, the attacker makes a sneak attack. Its Armour is 0.

name: Summon swarm
text: As for summon lesser minion, except you get 2, each has only 1 focus, and you take only 2 -1 tokens.

name: Wrath
text: Make other characters attack each other. Enemies with line of sight to you check MAS+magic+20 vs MAS+magic+num_enemies* aeor (single check), and on a fail, take "Enraged: this must attack the nearest non-incapacitated character they are aware of each round. This expires after 3 rounds." Also, anyone engaging you takes -2 MAS ueoc.
